sense.name: systematically collect opinions
sense.examples: Among the 19 countries that the BBC polled last year, views of the EU are largely unchanged. The survey polled the exact same students in their freshman and senior years.

sense.name: receive or cast votes
sense.commentary: Note: Related to sense 1, but specific to voting, not surveying opinions
sense.examples: He polled the greatest number of votes in that constituency. In 1980, when 65 per cent of the votes were polled, they led the alliance. Dody polled the vote as follows: Paul - Yes; May - Yes; Stuckey - Yes; Allison - Yes...

sense.name: cut branches or horns
sense.examples: I then polled the olive's spreading top. Rams can be either horned or polled and ewes are polled.
